content: That's a great point about building in some flexibility into the schedule. I think I'll try to group similar tasks together and allocate larger blocks of time for those tasks. Additionally, I'll make sure to identify tasks that can be swapped or adjusted if needed. One thing I'm concerned about is that some weeks, my workload can get busier than usual, and I might need to put in some extra hours to keep up. I usually work 40 hours a week, but some weeks can go up to 45 hours or so. Do you think that's something I should consider when planning my schedule?
